thread.title: Two men arrested, accused of string of robberies in Portland, Gresham, Beaverton
thread.title_full: Two men arrested, accused of string of robberies in Portland, Gresham, Beaverton | OregonLive.com

author: Tony Hernandez | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Two men arrested, accused of string of robberies in Portland, Gresham, Beaverton
text:
Detectives arrested two men in connection with a string of robberies at convenience stores and restaurants in Portland, Gresham and Beaverton, officials said Thursday.
William Maingi, 19, and Timothy Mark Beers, 21, were booked into the Multnomah County jail on Oct. 10, the Portland Police Bureau announced Thursday in a news release. Four robberies targeting Plaid Pantry and Subway stories occurred between Sept. 18 and Oct. 10, police and court records show.
Maingi was charged with three counts of second-degree robbery, and single counts of second-degree attempted robbery and second-degree conspiracy to commit robbery. Beers was charged with four counts of second-degree robbery, single counts of second-degree attempted robbery and second-degree conspiracy to commit robbery.
The Oct. 10 arrest came after a person in Southeast Portland's Woodstock neighborhood called 911, police said. The caller saw two men wearing ski masks and black jackets park a U-Haul van near Southeast 51st Avenue and Holgate Boulevard, police said.
When officers responded, they found the two men walking along the avenue and found gym bags and replica firearms.
-- Tony Hernandez
thernandez@oregonian.com
